intro: Cardamine breweri var. oregana, commonly known as Oregon watercress, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Northwest of North America. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, cruciform flowers and edible leaves. This variety is distinguished by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and its preference for moist, shaded environments such as stream banks and forest floors. It typically grows to a height of about 10–30 cm and produces small white or pale yellow flowers in late spring. The plant is valued for its peppery flavor and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
